section.title: Looking up GeoIP2 data from IP addresses
section.para: The &abbrev; application can lookup IP addresses from an offline GeoIP2 database, and make the retrieved data available in name-value pairs. Depending on the database used, you can access country code, longitude, and latitude information.

The &abbrev; application the country version and the city version of the GeoIP2 database, both free and the production edition. The &abbrev; application works with the mmdb (GeoIP2) format of these databases. Other formats, like csv are not supported.

note.para: To access longitude and latitude information, download the GeoIP2 database. The GeoLite2 City database is available for free of charge, but it is less accurate. The GeoIP2 City database has to be purchased, and it is more accurate. Unzip the downloaded database (for example, to the /usr/share/GeoIP2/GeoIP2City.mmdb file). This path will be used later in the configuration.

section.para: You can refer to the separated parts of the message using the key of the value as a macro. For example, if the message contains KEY1=value1,KEY2=value2, you can refer to the values as ${KEY1} and ${KEY2}.

simplesect.title: database()
simplesect.para: Description: The full path to the GeoIP2 database to use. Note that &abbrev; must have the required privileges to read this file. Do not modify or delete this file while &abbrev; is running, it can crash &abbrev;.
